title: Relationship Consolidation
description: This process will increase acceptance and soften unpleasant experiences, while increasing the presence and good feeling towards and with your child.

steps.title: Intro
steps.description: In every relationship there are some moments that are better than others, and I’m sure your relationship with ${hchildName} is no different.
steps.notes:
This process will increase acceptance and soften unpleasant experiences, while increasing the presence and good feeling towards and with ${hchildName}.

It will also offer you some new perspectives for the relationship.

steps.title: First experience
steps.description:
First I want you think back to your earliest memory with ${hchildName} that comes to mind now.

It could be an experience with ${hchildHim}, or the very first time you thought about ${hchildHim}. We will use this for reference for the following steps.
steps.notes: It doesn’t have to be to earliest memory you had, just the earliest one that comes to mind now. Describe it to me a little bit, no need for details, just a title for reference will do (i.e. first time talking about having a child with my partner)

steps.title: Unpleasant experiences
steps.description:
I'll soon ask you to sort all the unpleasant experiences with ${hchildName}, and any bad experience that is related to ${hchildHim} in any way.

I want you to dissociate from those experiences so you neutralize/soften any bad feelings that might still be there.
steps.notes:
Here's how you do it:

For each experience, see it from the outside, in 3rd person, so you see your younger self "over there" in it.

Then make the picture dimmer and B&W, mute the sounds, and allow the picture to get further away from you, so you gain some distance.

If you come across a particular memory that still has too much “sting” to it, pause the process, and [notify me](https://m.me/adamgoldman.me) at

answers.text: It’s better to experience them this way

steps.title: Good experiences
steps.description:
Now go back into that first memory of/with ${hchildName}:

*"${s1}"*

This time, relive all your good experiences related to ${hchildHim} and associate fully into them, intensifying the good feelings and emotions from each.
steps.notes:
Here's how you do it:

Relive each experience like you are there again, see it from the inside, 1st person, through your own eyes, see what you saw at the time, hear what you heard, feel what you felt.

As you relive these experiences, make each one more vivid, focused, crisp, and richer than the previous one.

Hear the sounds coming from all around you in rich full tones as well.

As you do so, notice where in your body you feel all the good feelings, and where do they move to as they spread and flow.

What did you enjoy the most in this step?

steps.title: Integrating good and unpleasant experiences
steps.description:
Now experiment with different ways to look at all experiences with ${hchildName}, both good and unpleasant, at the same time.

Try viewing all of them as a collage of different shapes, in a row, in a column, or any other configuration that comes to mind.
steps.notes:
There’s no “best” way to do it, and the more you experiment, the more choices you have to experience more of the presence, appreciation, and warmth in your life.

Which configuration do you like the best?

steps.title: Integration validation
steps.description: Now as you look at the ${s4} of all these experiences with ${hchildName}, I want you to make sure all of the pictures, good and unpleasant, are on the same physical plane.
steps.notes:
For example if all the good pictures are closer than the unpleasant pictures, either bring the unpleasant pictures closer, or push the good pictures a bit.

The idea is to experience all of them at the same time.

If you don't understand this step, it's probably means there's nothing to adjust anyway, so you can just continue anyway.

answers.text: They were already on the same plane
Now I made them at the same plane
Not sure I understand, but let's continue

steps.title: Differences
steps.description: Now as you look at the ${s4}, notice the differences between the good and unpleasant experiences.
steps.notes:
Usually the good ones are brighter and more vivid.

Is that the case for you as well?
Which other differences do you notice?

Write down anything you already notice.

steps.title: Increasing peace
steps.description: In the following section we'll explore different ways to reduce the effect of the negative experiences in the configuration you just integrated: ${s4}
steps.notes: Some parents find that there's not much negative impact. Even if that's the case, it's still a very healthy skill to learn, for both you and your mind.

answers.text: Not much negativity, but let's do it

steps.title: Increasing peace - Color
steps.description: Now as you look the experiences you just integrated (the ${s4}), notice what happens as you allow all the color to drain from the negative experiences, so they become black and white and colorless (or gray scale)

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Fade out
steps.description: Next allow them to fade out a bit

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Transparency
steps.description: Next allow them to become transparent
steps.notes: You are welcome to play with different degrees of transparency, as long as you still see them (the images of negative experiences).

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Zoom out
steps.description: Now try “zooming out” the experiences. The images would still be at the same plane, and the same distance from you, but the content of the images would zoom out.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Still & flat
steps.description: If they are not already still flat images, allow them to become still and flat

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Frame
steps.description:
Now how about putting a frame around those pictures?

Try different frames, see if anything works for you

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Lamination
steps.description: Next experiment with different lamination and glass over the images.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Muting
steps.description: If there are sounds or voices that go with the images, allow them to become muted, and notice if you prefer it that way.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Tactile
steps.description: If there's a sense of touch to the images, or any other tactile sensation, remove it and notice if you prefer it that way

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Word, date
steps.description: Now some parents found it further healing to add a word(s) to the images, or a date. It could be on the images themselves somewhere, above them, to the side or below.
steps.notes:
The words can be written in an artistic way, with decorations (gold is common).

If this doesn't make sense to you or doesn't appeal to you, skip it.

If you are not sure, the best way to find out is to experiment.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Additional changes
steps.description:
Now take a moment to play the “director” role, notice if there are any further changes you'd like to make.

Something you'd like to add or embellish in anyway.
steps.notes: We can always revise this later of course, and there's no "right or wrong" here.

answers.text: Nothing comes to mind at the moment
Hmm … There’s something I want to try

steps.title: Increasing peace - Additional changes - Description
steps.description:
${echo}

Great, what is it?

You don’t have to share, but … If something works for you, it might help many other parents as well, so anything you share is VERY appreciated.

If you want to keep it to yourself, just write something for reference.

steps.title: Increasing peace - Additional changes - Applying
steps.description:
${echo}

Now notice what happens as you allow that change to take place now.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings
steps.description: In the following section we'll explore different ways to intensify the good feelings and the effect of the positive experiences in the configuration you integrated a few steps ago: ${s4}

answers.text: OK, ready to intensify good feelings

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings - Glow
steps.description:
Now as you look at the ${s4}, make the good experiences glow.

You can put glow, sparkles and gloss all over them, and / or around them.

Also try making the good ones shine, so they radiate light and brightness.

Experiment with different ways and let me know which changes did you make.

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings - Color & brightness
steps.description: Next try making the good experiences more colorful and increase the brightness

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings - Focus & vividness
steps.description:
Now try making the good experiences more focused and more vivid.

Notice how much it increases the good feelings

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings - Depth & 3d
steps.description: If the good experiences are still and/or flat images, make them deeper & more 3D, and add motion so they become videos

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings - Zoom in
steps.description: Next try “zooming in” the good experiences. The images themselves would still be at the same plane, and the same distance from you, but the content of the images would zoom in.
steps.notes: It sometimes helps to think of a camera or taking a photo with your smartphone. You can zoom in the camera, so the screen is still in the same distance from you, but the image on the screen is zoomed in.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying good feelings - Tactile / touch
steps.description: If there's no sense of touch to the images, or any other tactile sensation, try to add it and notice if you prefer it that way.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Some more ideas to try
steps.description: Here are some more ideas other parents contributed to the process. Try them out and see if they work for you as well:
steps.notes:
* Put lights shining on it, like an art exhibition.  
* Frame the entire thing and laminate it in different ways.  
* Project the entire CONFIGURATION as a hologram.

answers.text: Projecting it as hologram is interesting …

steps.title: Additional changes
steps.description:
If there are any additional changes you'd like to experiment with, take the time to explore them now.

When you're done, let me know if you find something interesting.

steps.title: Experiencing ${hchildName} with ${hchildName}
steps.description:
Now as you look at the ${s4}, see ${hchildName} next to you as well in life size, 3d, full body, rich colors, and you can hear and touch as well.

So that the two of you can look at your past experiences together, talk about them and the good times you shared, the things you’ve done and learned together, and anything else that comes to mind.

Close your eyes and do it now, and let me know how did you like it when you're done.

steps.title: Jumping in and out
steps.description: Now as you look at the ${s4}, experiment with different ways to “jump into” some of the good experiences.
steps.notes:
You can zoom into one picture, relive it, and then zoom back out.

You can make one bigger so it covers all the others, step into it and relive it, and then step out and look at all of them again.

There are many ways to do this, and the more you experiment, the richer your life would be.

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description: And how do you feel experiencing ${hchildName} this way?

answers.text: I can focus on all the good times we spent together

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description: Do you have any objections being this way, experiencing ${hchildName} like that?
